definition: wide sea and sky (idiom); boundless open vistas/the whole wide world/chatting about everything under the sun
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
variant of 闊|阔[kuo4]
rich/wide/broad
day/sky/heaven
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time

sentences.english: Found to take a step back Sky is the truth.
sentences.chinese: 发现退一步海阔天空才是真理。

sentences.english: The sea in front of me is so peace and wide.
sentences.chinese: 我眼前的海边，平静的，海阔天空。

sentences.english: Endure a calm, step back broad sky.
sentences.chinese: 忍一时风平浪静，退一步海阔天空。

sentences.english: Step back and calm, a sports.
sentences.chinese: 退一步风平浪静，忍一时海阔天空。

sentences.english: Take a step back and get some clarity on the situation.
sentences.chinese: 退一步海阔天空，让局势清晰明白。

sentences.english: He just talked at random , I could hardly understand.
sentences.chinese: 他吹得海阔天空，我几乎都不懂。

sentences.english: Seasky, I wind, dust the banner of the North-South West to the East.
sentences.chinese: 海阔天空，我是阵风，把旗帜飞扬到南北西东。

sentences.english: Endure a moment, calm, step back, a brighter future.
sentences.chinese: 忍一时，风平浪静，退一步，海阔天空。

definition: lit. cool breeze and bright moon (idiom)/fig. peaceful and clear night/(allusively) living a solitary and quiet life
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
the future is long (idiom); there will be ample time for that later/We'll cross that bridge when we get there
Silence is golden. (idiom)
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
high as the mountain and long as the river (idiom); fig. noble and far-reaching
magnanimous/broad and level
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
sea/ocean
free and at ease/natural/unconstrained
life (one's time on earth)
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
